page.title: 01ELSRICKLE
page.content: Elsrickle or Ellsridgehill, the hills of the Elves ot Fairies, was in the Parish of Alston now enlarged to Black Mount, the name of the hill on which the village straggles on both sides of the A721 road, Glasgow-Peebles-the Borders. Since regionalisation, Elswickle is in the Clydesdale district of Strathclyde and the Community Council of Black Mount. It is in a farming district of beef cattle, dairying and sheep. Mainly pasture, with grass silage, barley, hay, oats and turnips in that order grown for stockfeed. There is a thriving agriculural engineering business in the village building large sheds for agricultural and industrial use over a very wide area, employing up to 10 men not all living in Elsrickle.
